TopicTitle: Will ksp2 be modable to at least the same extend of ksp?

Articles.Content:
I've learned over the years to really really be skeptical of "new" versions. So far each and every game that has a sequel has turned out to be worse, chiefly because modding tools suddenly get reduced or completely removed. (rome total war vs rome 2, starcraft vs sc 2, diablo 2 vs diablo 3. Original unreal tournament vs later.)

 

So I can't get myself motivated and am actually considering this a terrible move, especially since I hear of "multiplayer": multiplayer is often a mod-killer.

 

So what is the official stance regarding modding?
They are going to allow even MORE moddability.

According to the devs, KSP2 will be even more moddable then KSP1.

Edited October 9, 2019 by ShawnPhillips

What I'm curious about is the manner in which mods will be incorporated. Do you guys think we'll all still be using CKAN or manually placing/editing files to attach mods or will the process become more streamlined and user friendly. I know lots of people out there have multiple installs each with different sets of mods, just hoping there will be a way to set up modpacks and rotate them around without needing fresh installs and all the other hassle
